alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Grundy; Platte; Putnam; Schuyler; Sullivan (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Watch issued December 20 at 3:03AM CST until December 24 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Watch, dangerously cold wind chills possible. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 45 to 50 mph. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Kansas and north central, northeast, northwest and west central Missouri. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Watch, from Thursday morning through Saturday morning. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Thursday morning through Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
